handleEvents Class

Defined in: src/util.js:144

Add 'on' and 'emit' methods to an object, which act as a light weight event handling structure.

  • Index
  • Methods

Item Index

Methods

  • emit
  • off
  • on
  • once

Methods

(
  • list
  • predicate
)
Array

Defined in src/util.js:159

Filter a list based on a predicate. The list is filtered in place, with selected items removed and returned by the function.

Parameters:

  • list Array

    The list to filter

  • predicate Function

    The method to run on each item.

Returns:

Array:

Selected items

(
  • to
  • type
  • handler
)

Defined in src/util.js:182

Enqueue a handler for a specific type.

Parameters:

  • to String

    The queue ('single' or 'multiple') to queue on.

  • type String

    The type of event to wait for.

  • handler Function

    The handler to enqueue.

emit

(
  • type
  • data
)

Defined in src/util.js:216

Emit an event on this object.

Parameters:

  • type String

    The type of event to raise.

  • data Object

    The payload of the event.

off

(
  • type
  • handler
)

Defined in src/util.js:253

Remove an event handler

Parameters:

  • type String

    The type of event to remove.

  • handler Function?

    The handler to remove.

on

(
  • type
  • handler
)

Defined in src/util.js:199

Register a method to be executed when an event of a specific type occurs.

Parameters:

  • type String | Function

    The type of event to register against.

  • handler Function

    The handler to run when the event occurs.

once

(
  • type
  • handler
)

Defined in src/util.js:207

Register a method to be execute the next time an event occurs.

Parameters:

  • type String | Function

    The type of event to wait for.

  • handler Function

    The handler to run the next time a matching event is raised.
